title: Leaf Shapes Quiz
description: Leaves come in amazing shapes and sizes! Test your ability to identify plants by their distinctive leaf forms.

questions.question: Which tree has a distinctively lobed leaf that appears on the Canadian flag?
What is the term for a leaf that is divided into separate smaller leaflets along a central stem?
Which tree has fan-shaped leaves and is considered a "living fossil" dating back 200 million years?
What leaf shape is described as "heart-shaped"?
Which plant has leaves shaped like arrows pointing backward, giving it the common name "Arrowhead"?
What term describes leaf edges that have small, tooth-like notches?
The Elephant Ear plant is named for leaves that resemble what?
Which common herb has leaves that are described as "needle-like" and are very narrow and aromatic?
What is the term for a leaf arrangement where the veins radiate from a single point, like fingers on a hand?
Which tree has long, narrow leaves with parallel veins, typical of monocot plants?
The Four-Leaf Clover is a rare variation of which common plant that normally has how many leaflets?
Which plant's leaves are perfectly circular and float on the water surface?
What is the waxy coating on leaves called that helps prevent water loss?
Which tree has leaves that are nearly perfectly round and "tremble" or quake in the slightest breeze?
What chemical pigment gives leaves their green color?
